page.title: 05Local History (2)
page.content: The church of{St Denys}in{Stanford {Dingley}is one of the oldest in Berkshire. It was originally a{Saxon church before the Norman Conquest. Parts of the original Saxon masonry have been incorporated into the walls. Most of the church was built a little before and after 1200 A.D. The church now contains arches, beams and supports. Some restoration took place during the 19th century, but only a few additions were made. In outward form, the church, which is dedicated to St Denys ( not frequently remembered in church names ), looks much the same as in an early Victorian watercolour. The gravestones provide an interesting insight into some of the village's inhabitants' past activities and the frequent occurrence of premature mortality before the start of the 20th century.
